skill.name: verify-output
skill.description: Pattern for verifying your output matches required schema before completing. Use before writing final output to ensure validity.
skill.summary: Pattern for verifying your output matches required schema before completing. Use before writing fina...
skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill describing a validation pattern. No executable code, scripts, or network calls present. References validate.sh script which does not exist in directory.

content.value_statement: Agents produce inconsistent output that fails downstream validation. This skill provides a standardized pattern for validating structured JSON against defined schemas before writing final output, ensuring data quality.
actual_capabilities: Validates JSON output against 7 schema types (demand, design, task-output, verification, reflection, evolution-proposal, contract)
Lists common validation errors and fixes
Enforces compact JSON output format (single line)
Requires mandatory fields: knowledge_updates and reflection
Implements retry logic with max 3 attempts
limitations: Does not include the actual validate.sh script implementation
Only documents the pattern, does not execute validation
Requires external schema files to exist
Cannot validate without specified schema name and file path

use_cases.title: Pre-write output validation
use_cases.description: Agents validate structured JSON output against schema before committing to prevent downstream processing failures.

use_cases.title: Enforce output standards
use_cases.description: Teams enforce consistent output format across multiple agent types with mandatory fields and compact JSON.

use_cases.title: Quality gate for reports
use_cases.description: Validate design documents and evolution proposals meet schema requirements before submission.

prompt_templates.title: Basic validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the verify-output skill to validate my output against the task-output schema before writing to memory/tasks/{id}/output.json.

prompt_templates.title: Schema selection
prompt_templates.prompt: I am a Reflector agent. Which schema should I use to validate my reflection output? Show the validation command.

prompt_templates.title: Error handling
prompt_templates.prompt: My validation failed with 'X is a required property'. What fields am I missing for the design schema?

prompt_templates.title: Retry pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the complete pre-write validation pattern with retry logic up to 3 attempts for my implementation output.

output_examples.input: Validate my output against the reflection schema
output: Step 3: If valid, move to final location
Step 4: If invalid, read errors, fix, retry (max 3x)
Required fields: knowledge_updates[], reflection{} with what_worked[], what_failed[], patterns_noticed[]

best_practices: Write to .tmp file first, validate, then move to final location
Use compact JSON format (single line, no whitespace)
Always include knowledge_updates and reflection fields, even if empty
Implement retry logic with maximum 3 attempts before reporting failure
anti_patterns: Skipping validation and writing directly to final output path
Using pretty-printed JSON with indentation instead of compact format
Omitting required nested fields like reflection.what_worked
Using invalid enum values not defined in the schema

faq.question: Which schema should I use for my agent type?
faq.answer: PM agents use demand, Architects use design, Implementers use task-output, Verifiers use verification, Reflectors use reflection, Evolvers use evolution-proposal.

faq.question: What happens if validation fails?
faq.answer: Read the validation errors, fix the output, and retry. Maximum 3 retry attempts before reporting validation failure.

faq.question: Can I skip mandatory fields?
faq.answer: No. knowledge_updates and reflection fields are required for all agent outputs. Empty arrays [] are valid substitutes.

faq.question: Is my data safe during validation?
faq.answer: Yes. Validation is read-only. Data is only written after validation passes, using a temporary file pattern.

faq.question: Why does my JSON fail validation?
faq.answer: Common causes: missing required fields, wrong data types, invalid enum values, extra properties, or pretty-printed formatting.

faq.question: How is this different from manual JSON validation?
faq.answer: This skill provides a standardized pattern with predefined schemas for specific agent roles, automated retry logic, and consistent output requirements.
